td.paragraph: Shellfish causes patient's lips and face to swell. Has caused serious nausea in the past.

item.content: Please check all current medications with the patient.

tr.td: Take one tablet by mouth every 6 hours as needed for Pain for up to 30 days.

td.paragraph: 30 each
This is where clinicians document patient care coordination notes. These are considered longitudinal for the patient.
Overview:
Patient appears to have accidentally lodged an object in his right nasal cavity.
Overview:
Usually on exertion, but sometimes occurs even during short walks.
Last Assessment & Plan:
Patient still expresses difficulty breathing at times.
Graveen, Becky, MD

tr.td: Nasal foreign body, subsequent encounter (Primary Dx); Shortness of breath

playingEntity.name: WI Harbor Bluff North Family Practice

tr.td: 11/19/2013, 09/24/2012 (Contaminated Dose - Bad dose, had to reschedule), 10/17/2011
Quit smoking many years ago now.

td.paragraph: 5 Drinks containing 0.5 oz of alcohol

tr.td: Glasses of wine with dinner and other alcholic beverages throughout the week.

td.paragraph: Blood Pressure below 140/90
Custom comment for lowering the patient's blood pressure.
Nasal foreign body, subsequent encounter
Results for this procedure are in the results section.
2 VM X-ray on patient did not reveal any additional information.
No masses found on patient's lungs or other symptoms resulting in
troubled breathing. Patient still works full-time, though has
been advised to cut back on hours as it appears to be
contributing to health issues.

item.caption: REMOVE NASAL FOREIGN BODY (12/14/2014 3:14 PM CST)

td.paragraph: Foreign body removed from patient's nasal cavity.
Patient had previously been in an accident that lodged a foreign
object in right nasal cavity. Not severe, but was causing the
patient serious discomfort and exacerbating patient's past issue
of breathing normally.
